\gr 
\gv 
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 2v4
\xe  𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜠 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜊𑜧𑜨𑜰𑜫 𑜍𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜡 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜦 𑜆𑜩𑜤 𑜎𑜦 𑜉𑜠 𑜍𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜌𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜩𑜤 𑜽
\xex  mnq poj xEnq m; n[q yo]w runq pinq fa eka el pju el m; runq pinq vi[q bju /
\xn  man poi khvn ma nang jau run pin pha ko le pai le ma run pin thing baai 
\xr  'And returned to make himself spread out web into a stone, and roaming here and there growing it into an abode.'
\xv 
\gn  မၼ်း ပွႆး ၶိုၼ်း မႃး ၼၢင်ႈ ယႂ်း ႁုၼ်ႈ ပဵၼ် ၽႃ ၵေႃႈ လႄႇ ပႆ လႄႇ မႃး ႁုၼ်ႈ ပဵၼ် ထဵင် ဝႆႉ ။

\xv

\dt  21/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜍𑜤𑜃𑜫𑜫 
\lxx  runq q
\ph  run run
\ps  express
\ge  EXPRESS-worm.like.movement
\de  expressive word express a worm like movement, going backwards and forwards and side to side
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 4r5
\xe  𑜁𑜧 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜤𑜃𑜫𑜫  𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜥 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  x] c[q runq q pinq tU n[q monq /
\xn  khau chang run run pin tu nang mon
\xr  'The (chicks) then move run run, like the bodies of silk worms.'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  21/Aug/2011

\ph  jav
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  thread
\de  thread
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ma Likha Lit; (Medini Mohan); 8v5
\xe  𑜃𑜧 𑜏𑜩 𑜊𑜧 𑜈𑜃𑜫 𑜍𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  n] sj y] bnq ru[q /
\xn  nav sai yav ban rung
\xr  'The morning, the thread of the dawn, came.'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜊𑜧

\ph  jav
\hm  2
\ps  n.
\ge  web
\de  web; spider's web
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ယႂ်း
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2r6
\xe  𑜑𑜧 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜊𑜢𑜆𑜫 𑜊𑜡 𑜆𑜩 𑜃𑜩 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  h] n[q tinq yipq ya pj nj mEnq y] /
\xn  hav nang tin jip ja pai nai mvn jav 
\xr  'And to make the lady's legs step on the lush grass like a (spider's) web.'
\xv 
\gn  ႁႂ်ႈ ၼၢင်း တိၼ် ယဵပ်ႇ ယႃႈ ပၢႆးၼၢႆး မိူၼ် ယႂ်း ။

\ps  part.

\dn  𑜒𑜦𑜧 𑜄𑜠 𑜈𑜨𑜍𑜫

\dr  e ta bor

\gr  এটাবৰ
\gv  ယဝ်ႉ
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 2v2
\xe  𑜏𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜦 𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜈𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜠 𑜋𑜪 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  so[q et mnq b[q fo; cM y] /

\xr  'It was white against the sunshine.'
\xv

\dt  25/Jul/2011

\xn  an nang khai pha ru jem kav on cham ku ngin

 is partly opened.'

\lx  𑜐𑜪𑜤
\lxx  NuM
\ph  nyum
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\sn  1
\ge  clump
\de  clump of grass
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B61
\xe  𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜝𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜩 𑜀𑜥 𑜐𑜪𑜤 𑜃𑜠 𑜼
\xex  t[q fRnq knq kunq tj kU NuM n; a
\xn  tang phran kan kun tai ku nyum nya
\xr  'slaughtering people in great numbers'
\xv 
\gn 
\sn  2
\ge  bush
\de  bush
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 3v7
\xe  𑜁𑜧 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜩 𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜀𑜥 𑜐𑜪𑜤 𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜽
\xex  x] c[q nj xE[q kiu[q knq cM kU NuM xEw /
\xn  khau chang nai khvng kvng kan cham ku nyum khv
\xr  'They got to do suitable things at every bush and creeper.'
\xv 
\notes  In the example, the phrase <nyum nya>, literally 'a clump of grass' is translated as 'in great numbers'
\dt  10/Aug/2011

\xr  'In the cycle of time, the owl calls nyom, and the diamond star will say and put the lady and keep her on the side of the wide forest.'

\notes 
\dt  19/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜪
\lxx  lM

\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လမ်း
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2r7
\xe  𑜁𑜪𑜨 𑜀𑜧𑜰𑜫 𑜄𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜄𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜧𑜨 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜀𑜰𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜪𑜤 𑜎𑜪 𑜎𑜩𑜨 𑜃𑜩𑜨 𑜋𑜰𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜧 𑜽

\xr  '(The lady would say), My golden one would fall in any space, and I the lady would slowly come together with my Lord.'

\notes  In the example, the phrase rum lam loi literally 'together chase slow' is translated as 'slowly come together'

\xr  'Whenever the time and day is suitable, please release the lady so she may go.'
\xv 
\gn  သင် မိူဝ်ႈ လႂ် မိူဝ်ႈ ဝၼ်း ထုၵ်ႇ ၵေႃႈ လၵ်း ပွႆး ၽႃႈ ၼၢင်း မိူဝ်း ။
\notes 
\dt  30/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜀𑜫
\lxx  lkq
\ph  lak
\hm  3
\ps  n.
\ge  peg
\de  peg, post
\so  Loti Amra; (Prem Phukon); 8v-14
\dn  𑜏𑜡 𑜕𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜣 𑜁𑜥 𑜄𑜢𑜀𑜫
\dnx  sa eKa lI xU tikq
\dr  sagoli khuti-k
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; A4
\xe  𑜇𑜡 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜝𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜀𑜃𑜣 𑜁𑜪𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜣𑜆𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜣𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜈𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜃𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜡 𑜄𑜧 𑜼
\xex  fa c[q pRu[q knq lknI xMmE[q pIpnq pIknq cM bunq cM ninq eta t] a
\xn  pha chang prung kan lakni kham mvng pi pan pi kan cham bun cham nin to tav
\xr  'the Gods then assigned the sixty-year cycle, Kham Mu'ng, the cycle called Pan, the cycle called Han, from the space above down
 to the earth underneath.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  In the example, the word <lak ni> is literally 'the peg of year'. This refers to the custom of marking the days and years by shifting a peg
 into a different hole each day, on a board with sixty squares, each
 containing a hole.
\dt  30/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜨𑜀𑜫

\hm  1
\ps  v.

\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လွၵ်ႈ
\rf  Ma Likha Lit; (Medini Mohan); 2v2
\xe  𑜒𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜀𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜪 𑜋𑜪 𑜎𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜠 𑜽

\xr 
\xv 
\notes  In the example the phrase <kai ling> literally 'chicken feed' refers to the chickens that are raised, the house chickens, rather than the
 sacred chickens referred to in the earlier part of the line.
\dt  01/Aug/2011

\xe  𑜀𑜧 𑜌𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜣 𑜁𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜁𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜤𑜐𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜋𑜢 𑜁𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜑𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜧 𑜋𑜪 𑜼
\xex  k] vE[q fI xunq mokq xunq muNq lE[q ci xinq hnq mE[q n] cM a
\xn  kav thvng phi khun mok khun mui lvng chi khin han mvng nav cham
\xr  'and often pray to the spirits of clouds and dew, indicating the danger for the country'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  10/Jun/2011

\de  kidney

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫
\lxx  linq
\ph  lin
\hm  11
\ps  v.
\ge  roll.up
\de  roll up, to
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 6v1
\xe  𑜉𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜃𑜠 𑜋𑜠 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  miNq n; c; n[q linq k[q /
\xn  men na cha nang lin kang
\xr  'With the bad faced Hill Tribals who roll up their chins.'
\xv 
\notes  The reading of <lin> as 'roll up' in the example is uncertain. We originally read the last two words as lin kang 'tongue lose', with the
 overall translation of 'the Hill Tribals who have lost their tongues',
 referring to the fact that their language is not understandable. The
 reading 'roll up chin', as if to screw up the chin. An alternative
 reading would be lin 'stretch out'.
\dt  01/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫
\lxx  linq
\ph  lin
\hm  12
\ps  v.
\ge  pour
\de  to pour
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လိၼ်း
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 3v6
\xe  𑜋𑜧𑜨 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜪 𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜪 𑜽
\xex  co] n[q nM si[uq linq xM /
\xn  chau nang nam sing lin kham
\xr  'A lady who is the goodness of the diamond, like a golden flow.'
\xv 
\gn  ၸဝ်ႈ ၼၢင်း ၼမ်ႉ သႅင် လိၼ်း ၶမ်း ။

\dt  01/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫
\lxx  linq
\ph  lin
\hm  4
\ps  n.
\ge  river.bank

\lx  𑜎𑜆𑜫
\lxx  lpq
\ph  lap
\hm  1
\ps  v.
\ge  hide
\de  to hide, to be out of sight, to conceal
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 41r-15
\dn  𑜒𑜍𑜫 𑜑𑜦𑜡 𑜈𑜨𑜍𑜫
\dnx  Arq eha borq
\dr  ar ho bor
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လပ်ႉ
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B22
\xe  𑜇𑜧 𑜏𑜂𑜫 𑜑𑜢𑜡 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜩 𑜋𑜪 𑜁𑜤𑜆𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜈𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜪 𑜎𑜆𑜫 𑜇𑜪𑜨𑜐𑜠 𑜼
\xex  f] s[q hia n[q nj cM xupq mEw bnq xM lpq foMN; a
\xn  phav sang hit nang nai cham khup mv ban kham lap phom nya
\xr  'Whoever finds himself in these circumstances should kneel down in the evening time after sunset.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  In the example, the phras <lap phom nya> means literally 'when the horizon is hidden', that is 'after dark'.
\dt  31/Jul/2011

\dv 
\gr

\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 3v4

\xn  khan to man poi jin pin pha ring lvp mon kham 
\xr  'Thus he turned to a strong stone, the golden yolk of the world.'
\xv 
\gn  ၶၼ်တေႃႈ မၼ်း ပွႆး ယဵၼ်း ပဵၼ် ၽႃ ႁႅင်း လိုမ် မွၼ်း ၶမ်း ။

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜉𑜫
\lxx  limq
\ph  lim
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  grand-daughter
\de  son's daughter  
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 44v-24
\dn  𑜆𑜦𑜡 𑜊𑜣 𑜒𑜦𑜡 𑜀𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  epa yI eAa kokq
\dr  po ji o kok
\dv 
\gr 
\rf 
\xe 
\xn 
\xr 
\xv 
\xe 
\sn  2
\ge  child
\de  small child
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 44v-25
\dn  𑜆𑜦𑜧 𑜄𑜦𑜡 𑜑 𑜃𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  ep] eta h nokq
\dr  pe to ? nok
\dv 
\gr 
\rf 
\xe 
\xn 
\xr 
\xv 
\notes  The first sense has two possible meanings in Assamese: (1) son's daughter (po 'son' and jiek 'daughter', or (2) 'son and daughter'. The
 -ek is a third person suffix in Assamese. For the second sense
 Tileswar Mohan suggested that it might be /be to nok/ 'salary'. 
\dt  01/Aug/2011

\ph  liu
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  grain.basket
\de  wicker basket for grain; translated by Ranoo into Thai as 'krabung', 'a closely woven bamboo basket, about a foot high, formerly used as
 a measure for grain'

\dn  𑜄𑜥 𑜉𑜨𑜀𑜫

\gr

\xex  co[q xM liw xM xopq xM m; bo] 1
\xn  chong kham liu kham khop kham ma bau lvng
\xr  '... (gave) a golden umbrella, a golden rice basket, and one golden box''

\xex  mEw lo] epa xjfa kw [inq em] n[q mE[q /

\dv 
\gr

\ge  rest

\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လိုဝ်ႈ
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B177
\xe  𑜃𑜧 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜝𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜊𑜧 𑜈𑜰𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜼
\xex  n] mE[q bnq cM tkq knq nnq knq fRnq knq y] bw lEw a

\xr  'towns and villages will quarrel and fight among each other incessantly'

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫
\lxx  lEw
\ph  lv
\hm  8
\ps  v., adj.
\sn  1
\ge  exceed
\de  to exceed
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လိူဝ်
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 2r2
\xe  𑜁𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜀𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜈𑜰𑜫 𑜍𑜥 𑜏𑜣 𑜏𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜋𑜥 𑜄𑜊𑜦𑜧 𑜽
\xex  xi[q lEw kuo[q cM bw rU sI siNq cU ety] /
\xn  khing lv kwang cham bau ru si sen chu te jav

\lx  𑜈𑜣
\lxx  bI
\ph  bi
\hm  2
\ps  n.
\ge  cowrie
\de  cowrie shell
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 15r-2
\dn  𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜍𑜢𑜀𑜫
\dnx  eka rikq
\dr  ko rik
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B130
\xe  𑜃𑜪𑜌𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜣 𑜒𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜪 𑜇𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜣 𑜒𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜪 𑜁𑜠 𑜏𑜣 𑜒𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜣 𑜍𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜱 𑜼
\xex  nMvE[q sI Ai[q nM fE[q sI Ai[q nM x; sI Ai[q bI ri[q z a
\xn  nam thvng si ing nam phvng si ing nam kha si ing bi ring 1
\xr  'four containers of curd, four containers of honey, four containers of 'kha' water, one thousand cowrie shells'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\xex  nj [inq siNq bI ro[q <[q knq si[q lkq eka xjba tkq boa ?kq p[q <[q n[q mE[q /
\xn  nai ngin sin bi rong khrang kan sing lak ko khai pha tak ba phrak pang khrang nang mvng 
\xr  'Hearing the sound of the bear calling, growling, the king will say, "I will separate from the side of the lady of the country."'
\xv 
\gn  လႆႈ ငိၼ်း သဵင် မီ ႁွင်ႉ ၶၢင်း ၵၼ် သဵင် လၵ်း ၵေႃႈ ၶႆႇၾႃႉ တၵ်း ဝႃႈ ၾၢၵ်ႈ ပၢင်ႊၶၢင်ႈ ၼၢင်း မိူင်း ။

\xe  𑜑𑜧 𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜀𑜫 𑜈𑜩 𑜐𑜧 𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜍𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  h] mnq lkq bj N] hitq riunq /
\xn  hav man lak bai nyav hit rvn

\lx  𑜈𑜩
\lxx  bj
\ph  bai
\hm  3
\ps  v.
\sn  1
\ge  keep
\de  keep 
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝႆႉ
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 14r2
\xe  𑜒𑜨𑜰𑜫 𑜉𑜠 𑜁𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜀𑜫 𑜈𑜩 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜥 𑜽
\xex  Aow m; xokq likq bj t[q tU /
\xn  au ma khok lik bai tang tu
\xr  'The whole body of the horse has been taken and kept in the iron cage.'
\xv 
\gn 
\sn  2
\ge  KEEP
\de  grammaticalisation of the verb 'keep', showing that an action is past and will have long term results.
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ma Likha Lit; (Medini Mohan); 8v5
\xe  𑜇𑜣 𑜇𑜩 𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜉𑜠 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜀𑜢𑜤𑜆𑜫 𑜒𑜧𑜨 𑜉𑜠 𑜁𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜣 𑜁𑜧 𑜊𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜧 𑜄𑜪 𑜁𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜀𑜫 𑜈𑜩 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜥 𑜽
\xex  fI fj poj m; c[q tkq kEpq Ao] m; xunq xI x] y[q s] tM xokq likq bj t[q tU /
\xn  phi phai poi ma chang tak kvp au ma khun khi khav yang sav tam khok lik bai tang tu
\xr  'The giants came out, and taking the horse of the prince by force, they (the giants) put (the horse) into a metal room.'
\xv 
\notes  In the example the phrase sav (tam khok lik) bai is literally 'put (into the metal pen) and keep there'
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\xe  𑜈𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜡 𑜁𑜣 𑜊𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜇𑜡 𑜈𑜩𑜤 𑜋𑜪 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜇𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜡 𑜄𑜊𑜦𑜧 𑜽

\xn  ban ma khi jen pha baai cham ko phvn nin an la te jav 
\xr  'He came riding a magic vehicle, moving about in the sky and built the wide land.'
\xv 
\gn  မၼ်း မႃး ၶီႇ  ၾႃႉ ဝၢႆႈ ၸမ်ႈ ၵေႃႇ ၽိုၼ် လိၼ် ဢၼ် လႃး တႄႉယဝ်ႉ ။

\dr  phu lok
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  မွၵ်ႇ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 14r2
\xe  𑜁𑜩𑜈𑜡 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜈𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜉𑜩𑜤 𑜏𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜋𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜃𑜤𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜑𑜪𑜨 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜪𑜤 𑜆𑜢𑜰𑜫 𑜇𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜍𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜩 𑜏𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜐𑜠 𑜄𑜦 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  xjba Aonq n[q linq bokq mju siNq cEw nu[qu hoM eka luM piw fEw ru[q rj sEw N; et y] /
\xn  khai pha on nang lin bok maai sin chv nung hom ko lum piu phv rung rai sv nya te jau 
\xr  'The king led the lady to play with the flowers and trees of 100,000 types in the fragrant forest, the wind blowing the foliage and it
 falling down and scattering to form a mat on the grass.'
\xv 
\gn  ၶႆႇၾႃႉ ဢွၼ် ၼၢင်း လဵၼ်ႈ မွၵ်ႇ မႆႉ သႅၼ် ၸိူဝ်ႉ လူင် ႁွမ် ၵေႃႈ လူမ်း ပိဝ် ၽိူဝ် ႁူင်ႈ ႁၢႆး သိူဝ်ႇ ယႃႈ တႄႉယဝ်ႉ ။၊

\xe  𑜆𑜦𑜡 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜩 𑜒𑜦𑜡 𑜈𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜰𑜫 𑜎𑜪 𑜽

\lx  𑜈𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜉𑜩
\lxx  bokq mj
\ph  bok mai
\ps  n.
\ge  tree.mushroom
\de  tree mushroom
\so  Loti Amra; (Prem Phukon); 24r-8
\dn  𑜒𑜤 𑜍𑜫 𑜇𑜤𑜎𑜫 𑜎𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  Au rq fulq lokq
\dr  ur phul lo-k
\dv 
\gr 
\rf 
\xe 
\xn 
\xr 
\xv 
\notes  Because /mai/ means wood, Junaram Phukan suggested this might mean 'tree mushroom'. If read as /kor phul/, it would mean a kind of
 root eaten with betel nut.
\dt  14/Jul/2011

\dr 
\dv 
\gr

\xv

\lx  𑜈𑜂𑜫
\lxx  b[q
\ph  bang
\hm  7
\ps  n., prep.
\sn  1
\ge  area
\de  area 
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝၢင်ႈ
\rf  Ma Likha Lit; (Medini Mohan); 1r4
\xe  𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜠 𑜏𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜌𑜧 𑜎𑜆𑜫 𑜄𑜠 𑜃𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜈𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜠 𑜽
\xex  t[q k; sEw v] lpq t; nonq b[q fo; /
\xn  tang ka sv thav lap ta non bang pha
\xr  '(So that) all the people everywhere sleep safely in their beds.' 
\xv 
\gn 
\sn  2
\ge  in
\de  in, between
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝၢင်ႈ
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 2r9
\xe  𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜁𑜧 𑜍𑜪𑜤 𑜈𑜩 𑜆𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜎𑜪 𑜈𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜆𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  mnq c[q minq mEw x] ruM bj pukq lM b[q fEw pu[q /
\xn  man chang min mv khav rum bai puk lam bang phv pung
\xr  'He then flew into the shade of the elephant bamboo stem, between the plentiful leaves.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  In the example, the phrase <bang pha>, literally 'area cloth', is translated as 'bed'
\dt  29/Jun/2011

\lx  𑜈𑜂𑜫
\lxx  b[q
\ph  bang
\hm  8
\ps  v.
\sn  1
\ge  put down
\de  to put down; to lay down
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝၢင်း
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 1r5
\xe  𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜃𑜧𑜨𑜰𑜫 𑜈𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜣 𑜁𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜩𑜤 𑜍𑜪𑜧 𑜃𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜉𑜩 𑜆𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  si[qu no]w b[q sI xi[q n[q bju rM] no[q pinq mj pEnq y] /
\xn  seng nau bang si khing nang baai rem nong pin mai pvn jau 
\xr  'The diamond star king put down the lady and they stayed beside the pond were there are trees.'
\xv 
\gn  သႅင် လၢဝ် ဝၢင်း သေ ၶိင်း ၼၢင်း ဝႆႉ ႁိမ်း ၼွင် ပဵၼ် မႆႉ (ပုၼ်ႉ) ယဝ်ႉ ။
\sn  2
\ge  put
\de  to put
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝၢင်း
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 2v3
\xe  𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜩 𑜊𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜣 𑜽
\xex  t[q lj yo[q b[q nI /
\xn  tang lai jong bang ni
\xr  'All praised (her) as good.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  Chaichuen Khamdaengyodtai said that the phrase <wang li li> (cognate to <bang ni ni> in Ahom) would have meaning in Shan, as
 'in a good way'.

\xex  kw xunq bnq sI xE[q fa ?u; bw n[q eka pEw m] y] n[q hunq fa k]w pa; /

\xe  𑜆𑜦𑜡 𑜁𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜄𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜈𑜧𑜨 𑜉𑜦𑜧 𑜎𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜥 𑜁𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  epa xunq ctq t[q bo] em] li[q nU xi[q /
\xn  po khun chat tang bau me ling nu khing 
\xr  'Thus the father of the prince king arranges young men and women to feed and look after him.'
\xv 
\gn  ပေႃႈ ၶုၼ် ၸတ်း တင်း မၢဝ်ႇ မႄႈ လဵင်ႉ လူ ၶိင်း ။
\se  𑜈𑜨𑜰𑜫

\dv 
\gr 
\gv  မၢဝ်ႇ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 7v1

\xex  s[q pinq bo]w fa vuNq co] mo] tI em] nj kj /
\xn  sang pin bau pha thui chau mau ti me nai kai 
\xr  'Whoever is the young man of the sky sighed lightly at the place of his mother.'
\xv 
\gn  သင် ပဵၼ် မၢဝ်ႇ ၾႃႉ ထူၺ်ႈ ၸႂ် မဝ် တီႈ မႄႈ ၼႆႉ (ၵွႆး) ။

\lx  𑜑𑜥
\lxx  hU
\ph  hu
\hm  4
\ps  v.
\ge  recite
\de  recite, to
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 4v1
\xe  𑜀𑜧𑜰𑜫 𑜉𑜦𑜡 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜑𑜥 𑜁𑜩 𑜉𑜧 𑜆𑜥 𑜋𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜽
\xex  k]w ema mE[q eka c[q tkq hU xj m] pU cEw /
\xn  kau mo mvng ko chang tak hu khai mav pu chv
\xr  'I, the learned one of the country recite and tell the lineage of you, ancestors.'
\xv 
\notes  This word is apparently an irregular spelling of <ho> 'preach, recite>. Chaichuen Khamdaengyodtai pointed out that <hu khai>
 usually means 'cattle and buffaloes' but we would expect a verb
 after <chang tak>. In Dehong the word <ho> 'preach, recite, utter'
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\xe  𑜈𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜧 𑜇𑜠 𑜒𑜧 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜑𑜦𑜡 𑜍𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜁𑜪𑜫 𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜋𑜰𑜫 𑜽
\xex  buo[q et] f; A] mEw eha ru[q xMQ hitq cw /

\xex  h] n[q mM] co] ti[q rnq vo] rU hokq <[q xunq /
\xn  hav nang mem chau ting ran thau ru hok khrang khun 
\xr  'Making the lady secure her mind firmly, until they grow old and grey-haired, living side by side with the prince.'
\xv 
\gn  ႁႂ်ႈ ၼၢင်း မဵမ်ႉ ၸႂ် တဵင်ႈ ႁၢၼ်ႉ ထဝ်ႈ ႁူဝ် ႁွၵ်ႇ ၶၢင်း ၶုၼ် ။

\lx  𑜑𑜃𑜫
\lxx  hnq
\ph  han
\hm  6
\ps  adj.
\ge  full
\de  full, complete
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; A4
\xe  𑜇𑜡 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜝𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜀𑜃𑜣 𑜁𑜪𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜣𑜆𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜣𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜈𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜪 𑜃𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜡 𑜄𑜧 𑜼
\xex  fa c[q pRu[q knq lknI xMmE[q pIpnq pIknq cM bunq cM ninq eta t] a
\xn  pha chang prung kan lakni kham mvng pi pan pi kan cham bun cham nin to tav
\xr  'the Gods then assigned the sixty-year cycle, Kham Mu'ng, the cycle called Pan, the cycle called Han, from the space above down
 to the earth underneath.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  In Terwiel and Ranoo's analysis the calendrical cycle called <Pi Han> is literally 'year complete'. However, since <han> also means
 'revolve', it may be 'revolving year', a meaning also suggested for
 <Pi Pan>.
\dt  23/Jul/2011

\xe  𑜄𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜡 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜩𑜤 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜦𑜨𑜡 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜧𑜨 𑜑𑜢𑜫𑜡 𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜽

\xr  'And afterwards the sky spirit will order the (king of) the palace of the human world to make everything.'
\xv 
\gn  တိုၼ်းလိုၼ်း ၾႃႉ ၵေႃႈ လၢႆးၸင်ႇ ပူင် တင်း ႁေႃ မိူင်း တႂ်ႈ ႁဵတ်း သဵင်ႈ ။
\se  𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫
\sex  hitq
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 2r2
\xe  𑜂𑜢𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜊𑜥 𑜃𑜪 𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜍𑜥 𑜆𑜢𑜰𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜆𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜠 𑜎𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜩𑜨𑜐𑜫 𑜽
\xex  [iukq yU nM hitq rU piw mEw po[q fo; lnq Ai[q nojNq /
\xn  ngvk ju nam hit ru piw mv pong pha lan ing noi yav
\xr  'The Naga that lives in the water makes a hole and passes through the sky and stoops and leans back on the great mountain.'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes  This word is also spelled <h i t>
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\xex  xunq mE[q nj [inq AU si[q ro[q xo] ]wq si[q xo] eka munq m; to[q t[q rnq po[q mitq r; nonq /

\xr  'The prince of the country heard the murmur of them calling and barking, and the sound of them enjoying, echoing up to the level of

\lx  𑜒𑜢𑜃𑜫
\lxx  Ainq
\ph  in
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  crocodile
\de  crocodile
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 39r-1
\dn  𑜉𑜦𑜡 𑜕𑜦𑜡 𑜍𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  ema eKa rokq
\dr  mo go rok
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 7v4
\xe  𑜒𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜠 𑜂𑜠 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  Ainq tinq fo; [; c[q /
\xn  in tin pha nga chang 
\xr  'As the crocodile's feet divide, so also the tusks of the elephant'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜒𑜤𑜃𑜫
\lxx  Aunq
\ph  un
\hm  6
\ps  adj., v.
\sn  1
\ge  soft
\de  soft
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဢူၼ်ႈ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 7r1
\xe  𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜑𑜧 𑜉𑜧 𑜁𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜍𑜪𑜨 𑜲 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜃𑜥 𑜁𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  tkq h] m] xunq roM 2 mEw nU xnq Aunq /
\xn  tak hav mav khun rom song mv nu khan un 
\xr  '(The lady said) I will make it so that (when) you the prince are joined with me as two, (if anybody) looks we will be speaking softly.'
\xv 
\gn  တၵ်း ႁႂ်ႈ မႂ်း ၶုၼ် ႁွမ်း သွင် (မိူဝ်ႈ) (လူ) (ၶၢၼ်) ဢူၼ်ႈ ။
\sn  2
\ge  soften
\de  soften, to
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 39r-6
\dn  𑜀𑜥 𑜉𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜣 𑜈𑜨𑜍𑜫
\dnx  kU ema lI borq
\dr  ku mo li bor

\xr

\lx  𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫
\lxx  Aonq
\ph  on
\hm  1
\ps  v., n.
\sn  1
\ge  lead
\de  to lead, to take the lead
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဢွၼ်
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 6r6
\xe  𑜁𑜩𑜇𑜡 𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜩 𑜆𑜩𑜤 𑜎𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜌𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜃𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜑𑜪𑜨 𑜽
\xex  xjfa tkq poj Aonq knq fj pju linq vEnq k[qu nu[q hoM /
\xn  khai pha tak poi on kan phai paai lin thvn kaang nung hom 
\xr  'The king will lead her and go and play in the wide and fragrant forest.'
\xv 
\gn  ၶႆႇၾႃႉ တၵ်း ပွႆး ဢွၼ် ၵၼ် ၽၢႆႈ ပႆ လဵၼ်ႈ ထိူၼ်ႇ ၵႂၢင်ႈ လူင် ႁွမ် ။
\sn  2
\ge  before
\de  before, formerly
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv 
\rf  Ma Likha Lit; (Medini Mohan); 6r4
\xe  𑜉𑜧𑜨 𑜇𑜡 𑜐𑜪𑜤 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜰𑜫 𑜁𑜡 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  mo] fa NuM n[q kw xa Aonq /
\xn  mau pha nyum nang kau kha on
\xr  'The prince smiled, the same as before.'
\xv 
\gn 
\sn  3
\ge  in.front
\de  to be in front
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 39r-9
\dn  𑜒𑜕𑜫 𑜑𑜦𑜡 𑜈𑜨𑜍𑜫
\dnx  AKq eha borq
\dr  ag ho bor
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 15v6
\xe  𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜁𑜨𑜄𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜧𑜨 𑜈𑜡𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 
\xex  mnq c[q xotq t[q s[q ko] banq Aonq t[q 
\xn  man chang khot tang sang kau ban on tang 
\xr  'He will then take away and order his spider (to go) in front.'
\xv 
\gn  မၼ်း ၸင်ႇ ၶွတ်ႇ တင်း သင်ႇ ၵၢဝ် မိူၼ်း(မၼ်း) ဢွၼ် တၢင်း 
\sn  4
\ge  days.of.yore
\de  days of yore
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 39r-10
\dn  𑜆𑜤𑜍𑜫 𑜈𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  purq bokq
\dr  pur bok
\dv 
\gr 
\rf 
\xe 
\xn 
\xr 
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  22/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫
\lxx  Aonq
\ph  on
\hm  2
\ps  adj.
\sn  1
\ge  little
\de  little 
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gn  ဢွၼ်ႇ
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 3r6
\xe  𑜎𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜠 𑜌𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜪𑜤 𑜆𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  lu[q m; vE[q mE[q luM pi[q Aonq Ainq /
\xn  lung ma thvng mvng lum ping on in
\xr  'Come down to the earth, more or less level.'
\xv 
\gn 
\sn  2
\ge  small
\de  small
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဢွၼ်ႇ
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 11r4
\xe  𑜊𑜢𑜰𑜫 𑜎𑜥 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜁𑜡 𑜒𑜨𑜃𑜫 𑜽
\xex  yiw lU n[q xa Aonq /
\xn  jiu lu nang kha on
\xr  'He considered he wanted the lady with the (beautiful) small thighs.'
\xv 
\gn  ယဵဝ် လူဝ်ႇ ၼၢင်း ၶႃ ဢွၼ်ႇ ။ 
\notes  In the example, the phrase <ping on in>, literally 'level small small', is translated 'more or less level'
\dt  13/Jun/2011

\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဢိုၼ်ႈဢိုၼ်ႈ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 17v7
\xe  𑜀𑜩𑜨 𑜁𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜥 𑜀𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜨𑜡 𑜒𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫𑜫  𑜽

\dt  19/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜒𑜢𑜆𑜫
\lxx  Aipq
\ph  ip
\hm  4
\ps  v.
\ge  near
\de  to be near [Cush 689]
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B41
\xe  𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜏𑜆𑜫 𑜒𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜃𑜧𑜰𑜫 𑜎𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜪 𑜈𑜃𑜫𑜒𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜒𑜢𑜆𑜫𑜏𑜩 𑜋𑜪 𑜈𑜡 𑜃𑜧𑜰𑜫 𑜏𑜩 𑜼
\xex  poj spq Aokq n]w lu[q kM bnqAokq mEw Aipqsj cM ba n]w sj a
\xn  poi sang ok nau lung kam ban ok mv ip sai cham ba nau sai
\xr  'If a large star appears in the east during the morning, this is called the Morning Star'
\xv 
\notes  In the example the phrase <ip sai> is literally 'near the morning'
\dt  07/Aug/2011

\xe  𑜄𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜒𑜤𑜐𑜫 𑜇𑜡 𑜋𑜪 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜀𑜫 𑜄𑜢𑜀𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜪𑜤 𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫𑜫  𑜑𑜧 𑜀𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜰𑜫 𑜀𑜩𑜨 𑜊𑜧 𑜽

\xr  'After that, the stone broke into the rushing wind for the heavens.'
\xv

\lx  𑜒𑜩𑜨
\lxx  Aoj
\ph  oi
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  sugar-cane
\de  sugar-cane
\so  Bar Amra; (Junaram Sangbun Phukan); 56r-7
\dn  𑜀𑜥 𑜑𑜣 𑜒𑜡 𑜍𑜨𑜀𑜫
\dnx  kU hI Aa rokq
\dr  ku hi a rok
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဢွႆႈ
\rf  Tai Ahoms and the Stars; ; B115
\xe  --- 𑜉𑜀𑜫 𑜇𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜁𑜢𑜂𑜫𑜀𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜤𑜐𑜫 𑜏𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜀𑜤𑜐𑜫 𑜁𑜢𑜰𑜫𑜫 𑜀𑜩 𑜁𑜩 𑜒𑜩𑜨 𑜋𑜪 𑜼
\xex  --- mkq fitq xi[qki[q kuNq sukq kuNq xiwq kj xj Aoj cM a
\xn  ... mak phit khing king kui suk kui khiu kai khai oi cham
\xr  '... chillies, ginger, ripe bananas, green bananas, chickens, eggs and sugar cane'
\xv 
\gn 
\notes 
\dt  22/Jul/2011

\lx  𑜾
\lxx  @
\ph  ru lai
\ps  n.
\ge  opening.word
\de  a marker of Ahom orthography showing the beginning of a section of text. It is used very frequently in some texts and much less often
 in others.
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\rf  Ming Mvng; (Tileswar Mohan); 1r1
\xe  𑜾 𑜇𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜎𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜽
\xex  @ fo[q lu[q to[q fo[q mokq /
\xn  rulai phong lung tong phong mok
\xr  'During this great time, it is the time of the (meghela) flower.'
\xv 
\notes 
\dt  21/Aug/2011

\ph  sip it

\dv 
\gr

\xex  lkqnI npqmutq cM yU tuM t; nEnq : Aitq a

\lx  𑜈𑜦𑜨𑜂𑜫
\lxx  ebo[q
\ph  bong
\hm  1
\ps  n.
\ge  emperor
\de  emperor; great ruler; excellent one
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝူင်ႉ
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 11v3
\xe  𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜨𑜠 𑜁𑜪 𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜈𑜦𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  n[q t[q mE[q fo; xM hitq ebo[q /
\xn  nang tang mvng pha kham hit bong
\xr  'To sit as the king of the country of the golden stone and be the emperor.'
\xv 
\gn  ၼင်ႈ တင်း မိူင်း ၽႃ ၶမ်း ႁဵတ်း ဝူင်ႉ ။
\se  𑜈𑜦𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫
\sex  ebou[q
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝူင်ႉ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2v3
\xe  𑜁𑜦𑜪𑜡 𑜉𑜃𑜫 𑜊𑜂𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜑𑜢𑜄𑜫 𑜈𑜦𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜣 𑜆𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜦 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  exaM mnq y[q n[q hitq ebou[q tI piunq et y] /
\xn  ho kham man jang nang hit bong ti pvn te jau 
\xr  'The king was sitting on the throne as emperor over others.'
\xv 
\gn  ႁေႃၶမ်း မၼ်း ယင်း ၼင်ႈ ႁဵတ်း ဝူင်ႉ တီႈ ပိူၼ်ႈ တႄႇယဝ်ႉ ။
\se  𑜈𑜦𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤
\sex  ebo[qu
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝူင်ႉ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 7v6
\xe  𑜆𑜦𑜡 𑜀𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜧𑜤 𑜀𑜰𑜫 𑜋𑜰𑜫 𑜈𑜦𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜄𑜦𑜧 𑜑𑜦𑜪𑜡 𑜽
\xex  epa kiu[q pinq pu] kw cw ebo[qu et] ehaM /
\xn  po kvng pin pav kau chau bong te ho kham 
\xr  '(The father said), “If she is suitable to be a daughter in law for me, the respected emperor who has established a palace.'
\xv 
\gn  ပေႃး ၵိုင်ႇ ပဵၼ် ပႂ်ႉ ၵဝ် ၸဝ်ႈ ဝူင်ႉ တႄႇ ႁေႃၶမ်း ။
\se  𑜈𑜦𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤
\sex  eb>[qu
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ဝူင်ႉ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 10r1
\xe  𑜃𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜍𑜥 𑜋𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜂𑜧𑜰𑜫 𑜏𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜪 𑜈𑜦𑜤𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜄𑜦𑜧 𑜽
\xex  niuw rU co[qu []w so[q tM eb>[qu et] /
\xn  nv ru chong ngau song tam ma bong te 
\xr  'Above his head an umbrella shaded the emperor, shining with rubies.'
\xv 
\gn  ၼိူဝ် ႁူဝ် ၸွင်ႈ ငဝ်း သွင်ႇ တမ်းမြႃး ဝူင်ႉ တႄႉ ။

\gv  ၶဝ်

\xn  khrau jang ju bang ran noi nyav nu rau

\xe  𑜍𑜠 𑜊𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜣 𑜎𑜩𑜨 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜀𑜠 𑜏𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜄𑜥 𑜋𑜧𑜨 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜇𑜟𑜥𑜠 𑜒𑜠 𑜎𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜥 𑜽
\xex  r; y[q sI loj t[q k; siNq tU co] eka ?U; A; lo[q pinq kU /
\xn  ra jang si loi tang ka sen tu chau ko phra along pin ku 
\xr  '(The lady said), We would regret (if we were not) a pair, like all 100,000 beings and also the Lord Bodhisattva.'
\xv 
\gn  ႁႃး ယင်း သေလၢႆ တင်း ၵႃႈ သႅၼ် တူဝ် ၸႂ် ၵေႃႈ ၽြႃး ဢလွင်း ပဵၼ် ၵူႈ ။
\notes  The phrase phra along means the Bodhisattva.
\dt  16/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜉𑜝𑜣𑜠
\lxx  mRI;
\ph  mria
\hm  2
\ps  n.
\ge  emerald
\de  emerald
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  မျႃႉ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2v2
\xe  𑜇𑜣 𑜆𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜓𑜩 𑜆𑜝𑜠𑜎𑜂𑜫 𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜉𑜝𑜣𑜠 𑜎𑜤𑜀𑜫 𑜍𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  fI pu[q dj pR;l[q si[q mRI; lukq ru[q /
\xn  phi pung dai pra lang sing mria luk rung 
\xr  'The spirit offered him a shining diamond emerald throne.'
\xv 
\gn  ၽီ ပူင် လႆႈ ပလၢင်ႇ သႅင် မျႃႉ လုၵ်ႈ ႁုင်ႈ ။
\notes 
\dt  05/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜍𑜦𑜨𑜡
\lxx  eroa
\ph  ro
\hm  2
\ps  n.
\ge  palace
\de  palace
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ႁေႃ
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 9v6
\xe  𑜄𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜇𑜡 𑜀𑜦𑜡 𑜎𑜩𑜤 𑜋𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜦𑜨𑜡 𑜉𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜄𑜧𑜨 𑜑𑜢𑜫𑜡 𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  tEnq lEnq fa eka lju c[q pu[q t[q eroa mE[q to] hiaq si[q /
\xn  tvn lvn pha ko laai chang pung tang ro mvng tau hit sing 
\xr  'And afterwards the sky spirit will order the (king of) the palace of the human world to make everything.'
\xv 
\gn  တိုၼ်းလိုၼ်း ၾႃႉ ၵေႃႈ လၢႆးၸင်ႇ ပူင် တင်း ႁေႃ မိူင်း တႂ်ႈ ႁဵတ်း သဵင်ႈ ။
\notes 
\dt  20/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜇𑜟𑜝𑜃𑜫
\lxx  ?Rnq
\ph  phran
\hm  7
\ps  v.
\ge  create
\de  to create
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ၽၢၼ်ႇ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2v5
\xe  𑜇𑜣 𑜊𑜂𑜫 𑜇𑜟𑜃𑜫 𑜑𑜧 𑜋𑜰𑜫 𑜀𑜰𑜫 𑜁𑜧𑜨 𑜄𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜉𑜦𑜧 𑜈𑜃𑜫 𑜑𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜽
\xex  fI y[q ?nq h] cw kw xo] to[qu em] bnq hu[q /
\xn  phi jang phran hav chau kau khau tong me ban hung 
\xr  '(The lady said) (Then) the spirit made my Lord enter the womb of his mother on the famous day.'
\xv 
\gn  ၽီ ယင်း ၽၢၼ်ႇ ႁႂ်ႈ ၸဝ်ႈ ၵဝ် ၶဝ်ႈ တွင်ႉ မႄႈ ဝၼ်း ႁူင် ။
\notes 
\dt  16/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜇𑜝𑜄𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜡
\lxx  fRtq eta
\ph  phrat to, phraat to
\ps  conj.
\ge  moreover
\de  moreover
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ၾၢတ်ႈတေႃႈ
\rf  Pvn Ko Mvng; ; 9r2
\xe  𑜇𑜟𑜄𑜫 𑜄𑜦𑜡 𑜐𑜠 𑜃𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜃𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜈𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜀𑜩𑜨 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  ?tq eta N; niuw ninq poj bunq koj y] /
\xn  phrat to nya nv nin poi bun koi jav 
\xr  'And also the grass sprouting out from the ground.'
\xv 
\gn  ၽၢတ်ႈတေႃႈ ယႃႈ ၼိူဝ် လိၼ် ပွႆး မုၼ်း ၵွႆး ယဝ်ႉ ။
\se  𑜇𑜟𑜄𑜫𑜤 𑜄𑜦𑜡
\sex  ?tqu eta
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ၽၢတ်ႈတေႃႈ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 8v7
\xe  𑜇𑜟𑜄𑜫𑜤 𑜄𑜦𑜡 𑜏𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜢𑜤𑜂𑜫 𑜋𑜨𑜄𑜫 𑜀𑜥 𑜋𑜦𑜧 𑜀𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜩𑜨 𑜋𑜪 𑜊𑜧 𑜽
\xex  ?tqu eta so[q rE[q cotq kU ec] kunq xoj cM y] /
\xn  phrat to song rvng chot ku che kun khoi cham jav 
\xr  'Moreover, the two of them will shine, pervading the whole district, and (all) people envying them.'
\xv 
\gn  ၾၢတ်ႈတေႃႈ သွင် (သွင်ႇ) ႁိူင်း ၸွတ်ႇ ၵူႈ ၸႄႈ ၵူၼ်း ၶွႆ ၸမ်း ယဝ်ႉ ။
\notes 
\dt  16/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜆𑜝𑜄𑜫 𑜏𑜝𑜄𑜫
\lxx  pRtq sRtq
\ph  prat srat, praat srat
\ps  n.
\ge  tiered.roof.building
\de  tiered roof building
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ပြၢတ်ႈသၢတ်ႈ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 8r7
\xe  𑜍𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜝𑜄𑜫 𑜏𑜝𑜄𑜫 𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜆𑜦𑜡 𑜉𑜧 𑜇𑜨𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜽
\xex  rnq pRtq sRtq xEw epa m] fo[qu /
\xn  ran prat sat khv po mav phong
\xr  'The storied and tiered roofed building is the lineage that your father ruled.'
\xv 
\gn  ႁၢၼ်ႉ ပြၢတ်ႈသၢတ်ႈ ၶိူဝ်း ပေႃႈ မႂ်း ၽွင်း ။
\se  𑜆𑜝𑜄𑜫𑜤 𑜏𑜝𑜄𑜫
\sex  pRtuq sRtq
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  ပြၢတ်ႈသၢတ်ႈ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 9r1
\xe  𑜁𑜢𑜤𑜃𑜫 𑜃𑜂𑜫 𑜍𑜃𑜫 𑜆𑜝𑜄𑜫𑜤 𑜏𑜝𑜄𑜫𑜤 𑜑𑜦𑜪𑜡 𑜽
\xex  xEnq n[q rnq pRtqu sRtuq ehaM /
\xn  khvn nang ran praat saat ho kham
\xr  'To go up and sit on the levels of tiered roofed palace.'
\xv 
\gn  ၶိုၼ်ႈ ၼင်ႈ ႁၢၼ်ႉ ပြၢတ်ႈသၢတ်ႈ ႁေႃၶမ်း ။
\notes 
\dt  17/Aug/2011

\dr

\lx  𑜉𑜢𑜂𑜫𑜤
\lxx  mi[uq
\ph  meng
\ps  n.
\ge  insect
\de  an insect
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  မႅင်း
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2r6
\xe  𑜀𑜡 𑜒𑜃𑜫 𑜁𑜩𑜇𑜡 𑜎𑜨𑜄𑜫 𑜁𑜨𑜀𑜫 𑜄𑜨𑜂𑜫 𑜋𑜢𑜤𑜰𑜫 𑜏𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜏𑜢𑜂𑜫 𑜆𑜢𑜃𑜫 𑜄𑜤 𑜉𑜢𑜂𑜫𑜤 𑜽
\xex  ka Anq xjfa lotq xokq to[q ciuw siNq si[q pinq tu mi[uq /
\xn  ka an khai pha lot khok tong chv sen sing pin tu meng 
\xr  'And another time, the king came out from the stomach (of his mother) with the body of an insect, one of 100,000 things.'
\xv 
\gn  ၵႃႈ ဢၼ် ၶႆႇၾႃႉ လွတ်ႈ ၶွၵ်ႇ တွင်ႉ ၸိူဝ်ႉ သႅၼ် သိင်ႇ ပဵၼ် တူဝ် မႅင်း ။
\notes 
\dt  04/Aug/2011

\lx  𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜉𑜫

\hm  6
\ps  v.
\ge  again
\de  to do again
\so 
\dn 
\dr 
\dv 
\gr 
\gv  လိုမ်ႉ
\rf  Nemi Mang; ; 2r5
\xe  𑜎𑜀𑜫 𑜆𑜩𑜨 𑜌𑜤𑜐𑜫 𑜋𑜧𑜨 𑜎𑜢𑜤𑜉𑜫 𑜏𑜢𑜐𑜫 𑜄𑜂𑜫 𑜽

\xn  lak poi thui chau lvm sen tang
